overview.historicalContext: Erdős Problem #20 from erdosproblems.com. Originally offered with a prize of $1000.
overview.problemStatement: Let $f(n,k)$ be minimal such that every family $\mathcal{F}$ of $n$-uniform sets with $\lvert \mathcal{F}\rvert \geq f(n,k)$ contains a $k$-sunflower. Is it true that\[f(n,k) 0$?
